title: What are some great, interesting philosophical essays? - Quora

response.answer_text: I will suggest some shorter and/or relatively easy works to read: “Les Passions de l'âme”, by René Descartes, “Monadology” and “Principes de la nature et de la Grâce fondés en raison”, by Leibnitz, “Essais”, by Michel de Montaigne, “Pensées”, by Blaise Pascal“, “Les Rêveries du promeneur solitaire”, by Jean-Jacques Rousseau, “Metaphysik der Sitten”, by Kant, Über die vierfache Wurzel des Satzes vom zureichenden Grunde”, by Schopenhauer.

I like Isiaih Berlin’s: Two Concepts of Liberty It’s an amazing essay about the idea of “freedom” that everyone likes to claim as the highest value but most people have a very murky idea of what it actually means. Although the essay’s title claims two concepts of liberty, in reality you get a bonus and he throws in two more concepts of liberty for a sum total of four. And all this is done by a writer and thinker of the highest caliber. Deals don’t come better than that.
